fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40971].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you select the macros Status and Burndown, Sprint Health and Average Age of Resolutions specifically, add them to your page and export it to pdf, it shows the html code instead the macro normal view.

h3. Environment

*Cloud environment
*JIRA Cloud Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-010

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page on Confluence
# Edit the page
# Add the Sprint Burndown macro
# Add the Sprint Health burndown macro
# Add the Average Age of Resolutions macro
# Export to PDF

h3. Expected Results

The macro should appear like on the page before the export

h3. Actual Results

It shows the html code instead the normal view

h3. Notes
No Notes

h3.Workaround
There is no workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Macros shows HTML code instead of normal view when exported to PDF
The media macro does not work in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40958].
  {panel}

Suggestion CONF-19116 was recently implemented which drastically impacted the way we utilize Confluence.  Rather than hard coding what the people directory should display it would be appreciated if this "Can Use" filter be moved to an enable/disable option, or allow custom filtering.

Some examples on what this suggestion impacted for us:
Prior to this change, we would utilize the People Directory along with the User Profiles for Confluence Add-on to display a company directory (Based on Active Directory user directory settings) to our visitors.  Our entire user staff does not have a need to have "can use" functionality for Confluence, so this change now limits what is displayed to our end users which is currently only a handful of users.

Prior to this change we would utilize ConfiForms with a "User" field definition in order for our IT/Management team to log events relating to company staff (Again, not all staff have/need "Can Use" functionality).  Using this field type was a big benefit as it allowed us to tie into Active Directory to ensure names are typed correctly, as well as pulling in additional info if needed (Photos, e-mail addresses, phone #'s and etc).  This change eliminated this functionality as not all users were displayed, so we had to change this to a text field which limits functionality.
fields.summary: Create an option to determine what People Directory should display
Ability to not include page history in XML backup
Iphone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40952].
  {panel}

h3. Steps To Reproduce

# Click ...
# Filter for "Sprint Plan"
# double click Sprint plan
# clear filter field
# Filter for "Sprint Plan"
# hit enter
# hit enter repeatedly

+Expected+
A sprint plan in the editor view

+Actual+
Multiple spinners in the bottom right of the Create dialog (see attached)

h3. Workaround
Disable the {{Sprint plan(jira-sprints-item)}} module of the Confluence Software Blueprints add-on, and flush the cache.
fields.summary: Sprint Plan blueprint broken on pug
Feed a page table row/column to another page or Google sheet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40946].
  {panel}

When navigating to a non-existent space in which the Home page has the same title as the Home page of an existing space, Confluence will return a "Page not found" page and also throw an IllegalArgumentException in the logs. 

Instead of filling up the logs with such exceptions, it would better to somehow intercept the request to prevent the exception, perhaps by first validating the space key in the request, yet still present the page not found to the user. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a new space: Office Space
# By default, a home page titled "Office Space Home" will be created
# Navigate to that home page
# In the browser's address bar, change the space key to a non-existent key
# The UI will display the "Page not found" page, and an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown in the logs:
\\

h3. Summary
JIRA Issue Macro will not display when it's added in table header

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create table in any Confluence page
# Insert JIRA Issue/filter macro into table header (link it to any issue)
# Save page
# Observe the problem

h3. Expected Results
* The JIRA Issue Macro should display properly.

h3. Actual Results
* The JIRA Issue Macro display with an error _Getting issue details_
*  !jira filter.jpg|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
What's interesting - it works properly in page preview, the problem appears only after the page save.
fields.summary: JIRA issue/filter can't get issue details  when in table header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40907].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When exporting a Confluence space to a HTML page, the exported css is broken.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Export Space to HTML:
# Go to the Space you wish to export
# Go to *Space Tools* and choose *Content Tools*
# At the *Export* Tab, chose *HTML export*.


h3. Expected Results
The exported space should use the same style as the one on the Confluence Cloud instance

h3. Actual Results
Style is broken on the exported space. If you look into the site.css file provided in the zip you can see some classes are missing

h3.Workaround
This is _unsupported_ workaround. 

# Go to the problematic space.
# Open the page source in your browser. In Chrome, this is possible by right-clicking on the page and selecting *View Page Source*.
# Locate the first hyperlink mentioning *batch.css* and open it. You can find it with {{ctrl + F}} or {{cmd + F}} and clicking on the link that is displayed.
# Copy the entire content of the page you opened.
# Replace the content of the *site.css* file that you previously exported and save.
fields.summary: HTML export on Confluence is missing CSS styling
Make the Space Attachment Macro filterable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40905].
  {panel}

On top of original demand, I would add the ability to move comments (and childs) inside a page from a thread to another.
I have users that often reply to the page instead of reply to comment and that gets messy.
I also support original demand as cleaning is necessary.
-----
We would find it quite useful to be able to have more flexibility with comments. Currently, once a comment is added to a page, it is either stuck there or can be deleted. 

What we are finding is:
1) some pages become popular and attract long threads of comments- often diverging in to multiple topics
2) some users just don't "get" Confluence, and so when they're trying to add some information, they whack it in a comment on the closest available page (even though it might have nothing to do with what they are commenting about)
3) Project managers need to troll pages to make sure that this isn't getting out of hand, and create new applicable pages, and then cutting and pasting comments in to appropriate pages


To solve this, it would be really nice (in order of usefulness)
a) move comments from one page to another
b) be able to move threads of comments to another page
c) have more flexibility with entry types, so a comment can be transformed to a page or news posting
fields.summary: Move comments, making comments into a page, reorganise threads
userRunAs is undocumented.

h3. Summary
The Page Properties Report macro is set to default to show 30 results per page. The config allow you to change it to any value you want but the result will be the maximum of 30 per section.

h3. Environment
Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the editor, choose Insert > Other Macros > Page Properties Report.
# Enter the Labels you want to report on - this is the label added to pages containing the Page Properties macro.
# Show more option;
# Change the Number of items to display to more than 30;

h3. Expected Results
Display the number of pages you set.

h3. Actual Results
It will display the maximum of 30 pages per section. 
This will only occur if the report contains content such as images, macros like Jira issues etc. 
 
h3. Notes
There is no document about any limit of results per section. If you are able to set any number and it does not work, it is a bug.

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro only displays 30 results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40882].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Customer is utilizing the "Create From Template" macro to create new Meeting Note Pages based on a Custom Template
 When the button is clicked, rather than creating a New Page, the view goes into Edit Mode and edits the Page Created using this Button
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.08.1-0001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom Template within Confluence
 # Add a "Create from Template" button to a Page with the following settings:
 -- Select the Custom Template from Step 1
 -- Prepend {{@currentDate}} to the "Title of page to be created" field
 -- Space key of the current Space
 # Click the "Create from Template" button to create a page, add content, and save changes
 !Step3.png|thumbnail!
 # Go back to the Page in Step 2 and click "Create From Template" button again, change the date, change content, etc, and save

h3. Expected Results
A new page is created and other existing pages are unaffected

h3. Actual Results
When the 2nd Page is created from Template, the editor opens in what appears to be a new page based on the Template however the page is opened in Edit Mode. 
 !Step4.png|thumbnail!
 When changes are saved, it overwrites the previously created page rather than creating a new page. 
 !AfterCreating2ndPage.png|thumbnail! 
 Reviewing the Page History, the "creation" of the new page can be seen as Edits on the initial page. 
 !PageHistory.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
This only appears to affect the creation of new pages using a Custom Template; stock blueprints/templates are unaffected

h3. Workaround
* Create new pages from Custom Templates by clicking on the ellipsis button and searching for the Custom Template
* Make sure the Page Title is unique and not the same as previous page titles
 
h3. Other Notes (BB)
If you continue to try to create from template after the initial overwrite, the behavior changes to what we would expect to see.  The pages do not overwrite, but new pages are created.  This seems to only be affecting the initial save.
fields.summary: Create from Template Macro Using a Custom Template Edits Existing Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40870].
  {panel}

Currently, PDF exports can grab a large amount of CPU and memory if a page contains a number of executing macros and templates. If the page has not completely rendered before the *export to PDF* function is used, then a system can be slowed while the CPU and RAMare taxed during a PDF export which will attempt to render the same macros already underway before that page is fully rendered. This leads to the same macros being executed twice on a page, and doubles the amount of resources needed to render same.

As a feature request, it would be nice to have the PDF export:
# Not available until the page has rendered fully
# Only render a static version of the page, and not attempt to re-render any macros that are executed such as live templates, reporting or future macros, that add normal processing time and cycles 

This would prove beneficial in lowering the CPU and RAM usage, and help improve overall performance and stability in the system.
fields.summary: Have PDF Export check to insure page is rendered before allowing export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40860].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Page Index macro in large space is bringing down Confluence
h3. Environment
 * 6.0.0-OD-2016.08.1-0001, server 5.8.18
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a page in a large space (with > 2800 pages)
 # Insert _page index macro_
 # It would take long to be generated.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence generates the index on the page the macro is inserted with no issues.

h3. Actual Results

Confluence keeps going down with this error:
{noformat}
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789019500 Caused by: org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.SQLNestedException: Cannot get a connection, pool error Timeout waiting for idle object
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789021500 	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:114)
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789024500 	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.BasicDataSource.getConnection(BasicDataSource.java:1044)
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789025500 	at net.sf.hibernate.connection.DatasourceConnectionProvider.getConnection(DatasourceConnectionProvider.java:59)
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789025500 	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.openConnection(BatcherImpl.java:292)
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789026500 	... 27 more
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789026500 Caused by: java.util.NoSuchElementException: Timeout waiting for idle object
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789028500 	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool.impl.GenericObjectPool.borrowObject(GenericObjectPool.java:1171)
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789028500 	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:106)
2016-02-22 12:29:53.789028500 	... 30 more
{noformat}
and
{noformat}
2016-02-22 12:20:50.137789500 2016-02-22 12:20:50,060 DEBUG [http-bio-1991-exec-8] [atlassian.confluence.event.MonitorableCallerRunsPolicy] rejectedExecution Queue Overflow happened: QueueOverflowEvent{, runnableInfo='com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher$$Lambda$390/16819635@1b8ac5a', threadPoolExecutorInfo='java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@a5ae24[Running, pool size = 1, active threads = 1, queued tasks = 192, completed tasks = 8656]'}
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Error still happens even after the _pool size_ has been increased.

h4. Workaround 1 (for Confluence Server)

This is the Confluence Index Macro, which can be enabled/disabled via:
 # !https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/2041359/oZYNLidcDNI3S8o/Dashboard%20-%20Confluence%202015-05-13%2013-43-47.png! > *Add-ons*
 # Choose *System* from the drop-down
 # Expand *Advanced Macros*
 # Expand the *modules* on the right side
 # Locate the *index* macro and *Disable* it
 !disable_index_module.png|thumbnail!
 # Restart Confluence to release the existing threads

h4. Workaround 2 
 # Search for: {{macroName:index}} and you will see all pages containing this macro.
 ** Note that your content indexing may need to be rebuilt for this search to work.
 # Delete the macro from the pages in the search results
 # Restart Confluence to release the existing threads

If you prefer to search via the database for a list of pages, you can use this query:
{code}
SELECT c.contentid, s.spacekey, c.title, c.lastmoddate
FROM CONTENT c
JOIN BODYCONTENT bc
  ON c.contentid = bc.contentid
JOIN SPACES s
  ON c.spaceid = s.spaceid
WHERE c.prevver IS NULL
  AND bc.body LIKE '%ac:name="index"%'; 
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40856].
  {panel}

Macros are cool features, but the current method of invoking them could be a lot better.

From an ease of use standpoint, I would like to put often-used macros directly in the "insert more" menu (or the context menu for "{") with macro attributes pre-set to match my needs.  I did figure out that I could search in the context menu for "{" which is great, but still not perfect since I could find no way except using the mouse (click on the macro box and then click edit) to click an option check box for the macro (which pretty much negates the ease of inserting a macro that way).

It is nice that you can highlight text and it will wrap the macro around that but only if you go the long, click-heavy, route of using the Insert-more-content menu, and (with some difficulty) you can copy/paste macro insertions with the attributes set, but it obviously then also comes with the existing text data as well.  It seems like there could be some syntax that would let me invoke a macro myself.  Something like {macro:No Markup, nopanel="true"}text{macro} or something, which I could paste from the clipboard (I would paste only the initial {macro...} and then move to the end of the text I wanted to wrap and put in the ending code).  

I'm guessing this from other comments that hint that maybe you used to be able to do that, and, in fact, [your own wiki-markup tutorial|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-wiki-markup-251003035.html#ConfluenceWikiMarkup-TextEffects] mentions {color:red}text{color} which works in Jira, but apparently no longer works in the wiki (if it ever did).  All-in-all I really wish you would provide a "wiki markup" view of the page, so that I could edit all the codes myself (like Wikimedia does) even if you translate them in and out of the codes under the hood to some internal format.
fields.summary: Better support for macros in Confluence Wiki
User should be able to define in which format the date/time is being displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40841].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Page Tree Search macro root page search does not work as expected. Search is always done from the current page as root, instead of searching based on the configured root page
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

These are the steps I performed to reproduce the problem:
 # create this page structure:
 ** other page: othercontent (page id 557069)
 ** parent page: parentcontent (page id 557065)
 ** child page: childcontent (page id 557067)
 # on parent page, create pagetreesearch macro wiki markup in all possible fields:
 Parent page root search:
 \{pagetreesearch:root=parent page} 
 !pagetreesearch_doctheme_wikimarkup.png|thumbnail!
 # navigate to other page and search for childcontent (should find)
 ** *actual result*: search does not find anything (uses ancestorIds:557069 AND childcontent) – wrong
 # navigate to child page and search for parentcontent (should find)
 ** *actual result*: search does not find anything (uses ancestorIds:557067 AND parentcontent) – wrong

 * Note: this error happens regardless of the position of the pagetreesearch macro (header, footer, sidebar).

h3. Expected Results

In all cases the search should have been "ancestorIds:557065 AND <content>", because the parent page id is 557065 and it is specified as the root in the pagetreesearch macro.


h3. Notes

The pagetreesearch macro seems to work normally if embedded into the body of a page:
 # Navigate to "other page"
 # create pagetreesearch macro and point the search to start at root "child page"
 # try to search for contents belonging to "child page"
 ## Results as expected: (ancestorIds:557067 AND childcontent) – correct

As a test, I changed to default theme and configured wiki markup in sidebar, header, and footer. Got this error:

{{The selected context is not a valid hierarchical page}}

The error disappears after browsing around, but the problem remains the same – not possible to use the root page filter in this macro. Therefore, the problems happen both in the documentation and default theme.

Note: This bug was updated to reflect that the pagetreesearch macro works in 5.10.1, but the root page function does not.
h3. Workaround

There is no known direct workaround for this other than embedding the pagetreesearch macro in the actual pages (which defeats the purpose of having it available in the sidebar). The [LiveSearch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/livesearch-macro-163415902.html] macro may be an alternative, but it does not allow filtering based on root page (only on space key and labels)
 !livesearch_alternative.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using Page Tree Search in Confluence sidebar/header/footer shows hierarchical error and does not filter root page accordingly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40833].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attachments which have been deleted from a Confluence Page are still searchable after a Content Index is performed

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version 6.0.0-OD-2016.07.2 
* Confluence server version 5.9.x and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to a Confluence Page (does not need to be embedded on the page itself)
# Search for the Attachment using the Filename of the Attachment; it should display in the Search Results
# Delete the Attachment
# Search again for the Attachment; should not display in the Search Results
# Perform a task which triggers a Content Index (Move Pages, Create Space, etc) or as SysAdmin, manually trigger a Content Re-Index

h3. Expected Results
Deleted attachment does not return in search results

h3. Actual Results
* Deleted Attachment is shown in search results however when clicked displays a file not found error:
!AttachmentError.png|thumbnail!
* In some versions, deleted Attachments are able to be viewed like normal attachment
* The attachment also reappeared in the Space Attachment list by going to Space Tools > Content Tools > Attachments

Database shows that the Attachment has been deleted:
{noformat}confluence=> select contentid, contenttype, title, content_status from content where title like '%ExampleAttachment%';
 contentid | contenttype |          title          | content_status
-----------+-------------+-------------------------+----------------
   5046279 | ATTACHMENT  | 1.ExampleAttachment.png | deleted
   5046280 | ATTACHMENT  | 2.ExampleAttachment.png | deleted
(2 rows){noformat}

 
h3. Notes
# Rebuilding Cache does not seem to correct the issue
# Reindexing from scratch does not seem to correct the issue either

h3.Workaround
# Delete the attachment from the trash by going to Space Tool > Content Tools > Trash > choose the deleted attachments > Delete
# Purge the trash by going to Space Tool > Content Tools > Trash > purge
fields.summary: [Backend] Deleted Attachments Returning in Confluence Search Results

I am trying to add a viewer restriction to a web page here ->https://confluence.ges.symantec.com/display/CMSSR/CSS+-+Licensed%2C+Expensed+and+Capitalized+Software

When I choose a group that is at our VP level it appears to add the restriction to only allow his direct staff (i.e. first level down Directors ) to be able to view the page. Other staff members who cascade below the Directors - i.e. managers, IC's are not able to view / access the page. This VP group contains a group for each of their direct reports.

Please fix this so that it cascades to staff for all. For now, I have to either add all the direct reports and their sub groups or remove all restrictions. 

I am listing this issue as Major, since it impacts the ability for our team to do our work - that is, without adding the restriction puts us at risk and adding the workaround of all groups creates a nightmare to maintain.

This issue is in Confluence 5.6.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40823].
  {panel}

From the documentation:
* [Comparing the confluence-administrators group with the administrator permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/global-permissions-overview-138709.html#GlobalPermissionsOverview-Comparingtheconfluence-administratorsgroupwiththeadministratorpermissions]

The statement:
{quote}
The 'confluence-administrators' group defines a set of 'super-users' who can access the Confluence administration console and perform site-wide administration. Members of this group can also see the content of all pages and spaces in the Confluence instance, regardless of space permissions. They cannot immediately see the pages that exclude them via page restrictions without knowing the direct URL to the page. 
{quote}

Is not true:

h5. Steps to replicate:
# Login to Confluence as a normal user
# Create a new space, set the space as "Visible only to me". 
# Create
# Log out, and log in as a user that belongs to the Confluence-administrator group
# The newly created private space will be listed
#* in the Dashboard (Spaces List plugin) (confluence 5.8.x & Confluence 5.9.x)
#* in the Space Directory list (Confluence 5.9.x)
fields.summary: Members of confluence-administrators group can immediately see spaces that they are excluded from the in space restrictions

h3. Notes
If the user is in a group that contains both *confluence administrator* and *system administrator* or a group that just includes the *confluence administrator*, the process works without issue.

h3.Solution / Workaround
Add the *confluence administrator* permission to the group
fields.summary: Unable to add a label after creating a template with only system administrator access
As an administrator I would like to see what content is being accessed by user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40794].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Custom HTML page data sections are editable before entering Edit mode.
This makes it possible to edit the HTML sections before the page will accept the edits. And the changes will be lost after clicking  Edit button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to <confluence_URL>/admin/viewcustomhtml.action
# Push Edit button
# Push Cancel button

h3. Expected Results
The Input areas are gray and don't accept the input

h3. Actual Results
The input areas are blank and accept any input
fields.summary: Custom HTML page is editable before clicking Edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40793].
  {panel}

We are interested in using this for ISP contract terms.  In general, the terms of our contracts are 3 years, but it would give us visual tracking of those terms which need to be prioritized for re-negotiation each quarter.  

Eg of what we manage today in a spreadsheet: 
!Screen Shot 2016-02-16 at 2.02.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 
Since the decision on the granularity is mutually exclusive with the drop down, would be great to see something that allows us to take advantage of the pre-configured 5 year time-frame. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro: "Quarters" Granularity
Paste columns as a new table
Roll-up Release Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40782].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Disabling the *Confluence Mobile Plugin* also disables the *Workbox - Host Plugin* in *Confluence 5.9.X*. The same behavior is not present in Confluence 5.8.X.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Manage Add-ons in a Confluence 5.9.x instance
 # Find the 'Confluence Mobile Plugin'
 # Disable the plugin
 # Refresh the page
 # Find the 'Workbox - Host Plugin' and notice it is also disabled

h3. Expected Results
 * The 2 add-ons should not be dependent on each other. 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the Confluence logs:
{noformat}
2016-02-15 10:27:18,091 INFO [http-nio-127.0.0.101-8080-exec-2] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] disablePlugins Found dependent enabled plugins for plugin 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile': [com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin(MANDATORY)].  Disabling...
2016-02-15 10:27:18,092 INFO [http-nio-127.0.0.101-8080-exec-2] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] broadcastPluginDisabling Disabling com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin
{noformat}
h3. NOTES / Workaround:

Additional side effect:
 - Disabling - Confluence Mobile Plugin
 -- Causes - Workbox - Host Plugin to become disable
 - Disabling - Workbox - Host Plugin
 -- Causes - Confluence Mobile Rest to become disabled
 - Disabling: Confluence Mobile Rest
 -- Causes - Workbox - Confluence Provider Plugin To become disabled

You must have the add-ons enable in the following order to re-enable ([Relates to This Article about enabling the Workbox Plugin |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Enable+Workbox's+Notifications+and+Tasks+-+Host+Plugin+Due+to+NoClassDefFoundError]):
 - Confluence Mobile Plugin
 - Workbox - Common Plugin (If disable / did not chain disable in testing)
 - Workbox - Confluence Provider Plugin
 - Workbox - Host Plugin
 - Confluence Mobile Rest

Restart Confluence, flushing caches as described here (For Cloud this will require filing a support request at [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/])
 - {{[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Plugins+are+disabled+at+startup+and+various+timeout+errors+appear+in+the+logs+after+startup]}}
{code:java}
<confluence-home>/bundled-plugins
<confluence-home>/plugins-cache
<confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache
<confluence-home>/plugins-temp
<confluence-home>/bundled-plugins_language
{code}

 - Manually Trigger a content-index at this point, or the spaces will not be visable
 - Note that if you take the SQL route in the document above, only remove the following 2 {{bandanavalue}}'s unless there are other system plugins you also want to re-enable:
{code:java}
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-provider-plugin</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>com.atlassian.mywork.mywork-confluence-host-plugin</string>
    <boolean>false</boolean>
  </entry>
{code}
fields.summary: Disabling the Confluence Mobile Plugin also disables the Workbox - Host Plugin in Confluence 5.9.X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40780].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using the Page Tree Macro to display a Page Tree from another Space generates the following error:
{noformat}The root page SPACEKEY:Page Title could not be found in space "Space Title". {noformat}

h3. Environment
* 6.0.0-OD-2016.06

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Page and Add the "Page Tree" Macro
# Specify a Root Page from another Space; field updates to SPACEKEY:Page Title
# Specify the "Restrict to this Space Key" to the External Space
# Save Macro
!PageTreeMacro001.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Macro shows Page Tree of pages in the specified space

h3. Actual Results
Page shows {noformat}The root page SPACEKEY:Page Title could not be found in space "Space Title" {noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Not Specifying a Space Key in "Restrict to this Space Key" shows the current Space's Space Key rather than the External
!PageTreeMacro002.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Remove the "SPACEKEY:" from the Root Page field
!PageTreeMacroWorkaround.png|thumbnail!

Option 2:
If trying to display the pages of a Space, do not specify a Root Page, only set the "Restrict to this Space Key" to the Space's SPACE KEY
fields.summary: Root Page Not Found When Using Page Tree Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40762].
  {panel}

All user must be able to read all pages of a space. 
Fine :) but there are so much pages.
There is no possibility to pre filtering a page list on users or groups. :(

We need a function to filtering the page view for the user macros pagetree, children and recently-updated.

The filtering should depends on a special group and user list per page (editable like the page permission dialog).

If a user is on the list (or a member of a group) defined at the special page list, the page is listed via the user macros.

If the user isn't on the special list the page isn't listed.
Page with no special list entry will be listed.

The function is adjustable by a boolean parameter in the user macros pagetree, children and recently-updated.
fields.summary: Filtering option for user macros pagetree, children and recently-updated

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40760].
  {panel}

Hi,

As a software developer whose main use of Confluence is to document my code and methods for reproducibility, I find myself in need of the following feature :

The ability to insert full links (http://server/contextpath/download/attachments/...) to attached files inside the code macro.

This would for example be very useful when writing bash commands that involve retrieving patches and additional files.

Thank you for considering this as a feature request.

Regards
fields.summary: Add ability to insert a full file link inside the code macro

Hi,

We need an additional feature in task macro.

Right now it only shows these columns: description,duedate,assignee,location.
In order to be able to utilize this feature I would really need an additional column "statusupdates" - it should be editable in the task report display (just like the checkbox) and would be initially blank.

I couldnt find feature issue type to raise this.Please consider this as a feature request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40756].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The "..." menu at the top right in the file preview that expands to show the "Edit" option for Microsoft Office documents when running Internet Explorer or Firefox doesn't show at all since Confluence 6.0.0-2016.06.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Load up Confluence with Firefox or IE.
# Embed a Word or Excel document in a page via Insert > File and Images.
# Click on the thumbnail to open that document in the file preview.

h3. Expected results
As well as the download, upload, share, and close icons at the top-right, there should be a "..." dropdown with "Edit" that allows the user to edit the document directly in Microsoft Office or OpenOffice (as per [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Office+Connector+Prerequisites]).

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-22 at 1.32.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
The "..." dropdown is totally missing regardless of browser.
fields.summary: "Edit" link missing in file preview for Microsoft Office documents

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40752].
  {panel}

We're running into issues where the wizard for creating a new page from a blueprint has become cumbersome due to the number of templates we have. Users must scroll once you have 6+ entries whcih is quite low considering the built-ins include 8+ entries.

Some desired improvements may include:
* Larger modal window size
* List options rather than big detailed options
* Top/Most Frequent/Favourited templates
* Recommended templates based on the parent page - eg 'Meeting Notes' page automatically suggests Meeting Notes template. -- Yes I know about the button to create based off a template :)
fields.summary: Better Design for Create New Page Wizard

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40750].
  {panel}

The documentation theme ToC feels like very much old style. It isn't convenient and you need to click on the tiny expand collapse icons instead of having the ToC auto expand based on context,

See for example teh behaviour of: http://hecke.readthedocs.org/en/latest/build/MaximalOrders/Creation/ and 
http://hecke.readthedocs.org/en/latest/build/MaximalOrders/Elements/

To provide some background, we are currently evaluating few solutions. 
The overall look and feel with this specific example was raised by a key stakeholder as a blocker.
